long-description.p:
The graveyard is situated at Stockhole Lane, Cloghran, Co. Dublin and is perched on top of the Rock of Cloghran, owned by the Church of Ireland. This site is a national monument that had been allowed, through lack of resources of the owners to fall into a serious state of neglect. Cloghran Historical Society obtained permission from the owners to initiate a restoration programme.
Work commenced on the restoration project in 2003 with the restoration of the graves and a complete clean-up of the site. When this was complete the work moved on to restoring the walls surrounding the graveyard.
There was of 18th century church which is now demolished and was also built on the site of earlier
Church dating back to the 12 century which was built by by Ryryd, son of Owen Gwyneth, Prince of North Wales.

To find the cache you need to note the following information.
At the above coords take note of the last two digits of when the new church was erected call this AB.
Note the last two digits of what the earliest recorded burial is call these CD.
Note the last digit of the missing year the heritage council lent its support call this E.
The cache can be found at: N53 25.(D+E)(B+E)C W006 13.(A+C)(B-D)(B+C+D)

ul.li:
2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
My second cache in Ireland... was easy and quick [:)]
TFTC and kind regards from Austria, eve

2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
A quick find with eve1987 on our Caching Tour through Ireland. TFTC, GudrunXY

2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by weitzclan
took a lot of looking but eventually shook it out. TFTC.

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Found in the end....took a little while...TFTC...

2010-04-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Went to the airport today to pick up a friend. Left a bit earlier to allow for this little multi. Jumped to a few conclusions about the final location after calculating the coordinates before looking at the GPSr for directions. Found GZ without problem, looked in the "where would I hide it" spot... nothing. Looked around at other possible hiding places for a cache this size... nothing. Back to the obvious spot, looked again and there it was, right before my very eyes. Well camouflaged, the container blends right in. And I even took off the sunglasses before searching as I have realized on other occasions that they make spotting containers more difficult. Thanks for making the wait a pleasant one.

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Cloghran
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The graveyard is situated at Stockhole Lane, Cloghran, Co. Dublin and is perched on top of the Rock of Cloghran, owned by the Church of Ireland. This site is a national monument that had been allowed, through lack of resources of the owners to fall into a serious state of neglect. Cloghran Historical Society obtained permission from the owners to initiate a restoration programme.
Work commenced on the restoration project in 2003 with the restoration of the graves and a complete clean-up of the site. When this was complete the work moved on to restoring the walls surrounding the graveyard.
There was of 18th century church which is now demolished and was also built on the site of earlier
Church dating back to the 12 century which was built by by Ryryd, son of Owen Gwyneth, Prince of North Wales.

The Cache

To find the cache you need to note the following information.
At the above coords take note of the last two digits of when the new church was erected call this AB.
Note the last two digits of what the earliest recorded burial is call these CD.
Note the last digit of the missing year the heritage council lent its support call this E.
The cache can be found at: N53 25.(D+E)(B+E)C W006 13.(A+C)(B-D)(B+C+D)
